intro: Hieracium robustum subsp. syrmiense, commonly known as the Sirmium hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows, roadsides, and forest edges. The plant features a rosette of basal leaves that are hairy and have a rough texture. Its flowering stems bear yellow flowers arranged in a single, terminal capitulum. It is characterized by its robust growth and is often found in regions with temperate climates.
